articles.title: Indians Advised To Leave Niger As Military Coup Triggers Violence - NDTV
articles.description: Indians living in Niger have been advised to leave the West African country in view of the escalating violence triggered by last month's military coup.
articles.content:
The government is closely monitoring the developments in Niger, foreign ministry said.

articles.author: Reuters
articles.title: Niger coup-backers protest at French base as regional force mulls intervention | Mint - Mint
articles.description: ECOWAS - the Economic Community of West African States - ordered the activation of a standby force on Thursday, two weeks after generals ousted President Mohamed Bazoum in the seventh coup in West and Central Africa in three years.
articles.content: Hundreds of pro-coup protesters demonstrated in front of a French army base in Niger's capital Niamey on Friday, as West Africa's regional body made moves towards a possible military intervention to … [+5059 chars]
